definition: A term commonly employed to refer to the point of entry or entrance into a particular space, such as a building, room, or area. It is often used to describe the physical location where individuals gain access to a specific place.

examples.german: Der Eingang zum Park ist auf der linken Seite.
examples.english: The entrance to the park is on the left side.

examples.german: Der Eingangsbereich des Museums ist sehr beeindruckend.
examples.english: The entrance area of the museum is very impressive.

examples.german: Der Eingang zur U-Bahn-Station ist hier um die Ecke.
examples.english: The entrance to the subway station is around the corner.

examples.german: Der Eingang des Gebäudes ist barrierefrei.
examples.english: The entrance of the building is wheelchair accessible.
